speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: Damn, Jim, you fell asleep? We're on a stakeout, man.

speaker: AGENT LEEDS
line: I guess... I don't know.

speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: What happened over there?

speaker: AGENT LEEDS
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: The house, man. Front door's wide open. How long you been out?

speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: We'd better check it.

speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: The light's out. The door's open. I don't like this.

speaker: AGENT LEEDS
line: Looks like they all left.

speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: I'm not so sure.

speaker: AGENT LEEDS
line: This can't be.

speaker: AGENT LEEDS
line: Oh, God. Stedman!

speaker: AGENT STEDMAN
line: They're all dead.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's, uh, it's Agent Scully. I'm sorry to wake you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got a call about 20 minutes ago from Assistant Director Skinner. He has a situation.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An Agent is dead. Um, Skinner had him surveilling a religious cult in Pittsburgh. And all the followers are dead, as well.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What happened?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's having difficulty determining that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'll pick you up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, Agent Doggett. I can't go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um, something unexpected has come up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I'm, I'm fine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Will I see you later?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, as soon as I can.

speaker: NURSE
line: Miss Scully? The doctor wants to see you right away.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where's Agent Scully?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Running late. What do we have?

speaker: SKINNER
line: One of our men doing routine surveillance on a cult group-- the Ibogan Temple. We had a tip they were trafficking narcotics. Nobody suspected anything like this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent James Leeds. Six-year veteran of the Bureau, father of two. Patrol cop found him. Car was locked from the inside.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Nobody saw or heard anything?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This couldn't have happened here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Blood splatter on the seat says it did.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's too narrow. There's no room to swing the weapon. Besides, it doesn't make any sense. The gun's still holstered and the key's in the ignition. Even if he fell asleep...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is damn weird.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It gets weirder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: These people were all killed the same way as our guy. All 20 cult members dead from a single deep wound to the forehead.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is this every member?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Except one. Their leader, Anthony Tipet, is missing.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Tipet was a convicted murderer who claimed to have found God. We didn't think we were dealing with an apocalyptic cult. We've seen this kind of thing before. Jonestown, Heaven's Gate.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't care how devoted they were. These people wouldn't just lie here and let their leader bash their brains in. I got to figure at least one of them would have had a problem with that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's something I've considered. I'm running tox tests on all the bodies for drugs.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Does that include our man in the car?

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: A.D. Skinner? We're still unable to locate Agent Stedman.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Angus Stedman?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Leeds' partner, do you know him?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where'd you look?

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: He wasn't checked into the same motel as Leeds. He's not answering his cell or his pager.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Did you check his condo?

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: His condo?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, Stedman's from Pittsburgh. He keeps a condo here that belonged to his folks.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Angus Stedman, it's John Doggett.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Doggett.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: The body is but clay... a shell If we have the courage to see into darkness we see into God... free of the clay which confines us.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Anthony Tipet served 12 years for the bludgeoning death of his wife. After his release, he became a minister preaching a hybrid of evangelical and eastern religions. He claimed a higher plane of being could be reached by the Via Negativa-- the path of darkness-- the plane closer to God. Once reached, it would let the spirit travel unhindered. Tipet believed hallucinogens would lead him to this plane-- specifically compounds of the bark of an African tree... the Iboga.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: You're saying all these people were so stoned on this bark they just let their leader kill them?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We found no trace of the drug in the blood of any of the victims.

speaker: KERSH
line: I don't understand. How in the hell did Tipet manage to slaughter all these people?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tipet was paranoid but nothing indicates he was ready to take the lives of his own people or our men.

speaker: KERSH
line: This is our one and only suspect. Are you telling me he didn't do it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Whoever did this left not even a trace how: No prints, no forensic evidence whatsoever. Agent Leeds' sedan, the cult house, Agent Stedman's condoâ€¦ were all locked from the inside.

speaker: KERSH
line: That's impossible.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Unless Tipet took the drug and succeeded. Unless his consciousness was there but his body was somewhere else.

speaker: KERSH
line: The X-File explanation. I take it this theory comes from Agent Scully?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully has yet to reach any conclusions, sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: That's the problem. I'm not hearing conclusions from either one of you. If this man has reached a higher plane then explain to me why 22 people are dead including two FBI Agents. Now I want to hear what you're going to do about it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If I'm working this case, I'd appreciate a heads up before you tell the Deputy Director any more science fiction stories.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hey, I don't have another explanation.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Those guys in there are right. This whole story doesn't make a damn bit of sense.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm supposed to give those guys in there answers, Agent Doggett. You're supposed to help me do that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tipet's on the run. Find him, and we just might.

speaker: HOMELESS MAN
line: Spare change?

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: I don't have anything. Sorry.

speaker: HOMELESS MAN
line: Now, come on, man. I know you got something 'cause I hear it jingling in your pocket.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: You don't want to know me.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: Pick up the phone, damn you. Pick up the damn phone! You did this. You... did this. God help you, Andre. I can't.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Ah!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett. Coroner's report.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Victims all killed by a single blow from an axe blade, six to eight inches long.

speaker: SKINNER
line: These photos of wound patterns don't match up to any known make or manufacturer.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This fit the description?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's a ceremonial axe used over a thousand years ago to cleave the skulls of unbelievers. This was required reading for Tipet's followers.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is this our weapon?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, sir. It's on permanent display in a Calcutta museum.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Another dead-end.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Like everything else in this case.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm a good investigator but you know as well as I do I'm not the Agent that should be investigating this case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully can't be here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You spoke to her?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Tonight. She told me to tell you she's fine. She's taking some personal time.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've got 22 people dead, and she's taking personal time?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're not listening to what I'm telling you. Do your best without her.

speaker: HOMELESS MAN
line: Spare change? I'll take whatever you got.

speaker: HOMELESS MAN
line: Ah, no! No!!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I think we caught a break. A homeless man was found dead in Pittsburgh two hours ago. I had them e-mail me some digital photos.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Any witnesses?

speaker: SKINNER
line: A man fitting Tipet's description was ID'd using the pay phone earlier in the night.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So we got something?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. There's no concrete evidence against him. There's no fingerprints, no hair and fiber.

speaker: [TD
line: "Concrete evidence"? A groaner from Skinner, gotta be a first!]

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You got the guy at the scene.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's nothing to link him to the murder itself, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I'm supposed to believe this guy doped his way into another plane of reality? That his spirit is going around killing people?

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, just suppose... suppose that this drug finally did what Tipet said it would. That his spirit could be in one place while his body was in another.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Then tell me why he's doing it. If he's looking for God, why is he killing people? Just 'cause I'm assigned to the X-Files you want me to think like Scully or Mulder would. You got the wrong guy. I need facts, not wild ideas.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right. Then consider this one. I had Pittsburgh P.D. check the log at that pay phone. 11. 412 555 4344 MK Stone
30pm 412 555-3272 At the Top
43pm 421 555-4367 Ridders
23pm 412 555-5671 Pitts Taxi
12pm 202 555-9212 Andre Bormanis
16pm 412 555-5671 Tambers

speaker: DOGGETT
line: 10:12 PM, a call was placed to one Andre Bormanis.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's a convicted drug dealer that served time with Tipet. That number's a DC area code.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: FBI. Open up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Bormanis? Andre Bormanis?

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Doctor Bormanis.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Doggett. Agent Skinner. Can we have a word with you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You always up at this hour, Dr. Bormanis?

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: It's when I dissect my rats. Neighbors can't hear 'em screaming.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: That's a joke.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You spoke to Anthony Tipet earlier this evening.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: My machine picked up. I-I-I missed the call.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What did he want?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We need to find him, Dr. Bormanis. This man may have murdered 23 people.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Twenty-three? You-you said... twenty-two.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Another man died tonight.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: I'm not doing anything illegal here. I... I just... I just made him stuff.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You mean drugs. You supplied Anthony Tipet with drugs, isn't that right?

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Hallucinogens were Tipet's way into the depths of the soul, the heights of consciousness, planes of being that our feeble brain chemistry cannot begin to imagine.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is that why you cut yourself? Or is that the, uh... mark of the initiated?

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: It's a protection. At least I hope it is. Nobody took the trips but Tipet. See, only his mind was strong enough.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, I can't tell, doctor, whether you admire Tipet or you're afraid of him. Those people he killed last night, did they admire him, too?

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: What are you doing?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Taking you in for questioning.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: On what charges? I just... I just... explained it to you.

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Ah! Don't! Look...

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: I need that!

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: No, please! Ugh! Don't-don't leave me! Please!! Don't leave me!

speaker: [TD
line: And I dropped my jaw! Way cool and very freaky stuff, I vote this one of the Top Ten Best Scenes on the show to date. Spooky!]

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's Agent Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Skinner told me about the case. I know that you covered for me. You didn't have to do that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's all right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I appreciate your discretion.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, well, it's easy to be discreet when you don't know what's going on. Are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fine. Skinner says that you're on the clock on this thing. You need to get your rest.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I just grabbed a few winks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I asked him to contact some friends of Mulder's. I think they'll be able to help.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I appreciate all the help I can get.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doggett, you're a good agent. Trust your instincts.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Lab tests showed that the drug that Bormanis was cooking up was some kind of a super amphetamine. Legal or not, no one's ever seen it before. Do you think it was intended for Tipet?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He wants it for himself. He doesn't want to go to sleep.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I want to talk to him... now.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can we get this gate open? Get it open now!

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Ugh!

speaker: [TD
line: He, he, indeedy, lots of 'em, yuck!]

speaker: ANDRE BORMANIS
line: Ugh!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett, what is it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Open it up.

speaker: BYERS
line: ...stories that belong to Mulder and Scully, not us.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Come on, Byers. We have a right to information.

speaker: BYERS
line: It's not our information.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: How many times have we saved Mulder's butt?

speaker: LANGLY
line: How many times have we saved Scully's?

speaker: BYERS
line: I'm telling you, these files are theirs. They're private.

speaker: [TD
line: Took me a minute to figure out what Langly was doing as well. He's lining up a pencil and shoots it at the ceiling when they notice Doggett in the doorway. A nod to "Chinga" *sniff*]

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And I'm telling you Mulder wouldn't mind. We practically solved half these cases for him.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah, Byers, quit your whining-- nobody likes a crybaby.

speaker: BYERS
line: Agent Scully asked us to give our assistance not to go through her f-files.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Like she's going to care.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Yeah, right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I help you gentlemen?

speaker: BYERS
line: You must be Agent Doggett. I'm... John Byers. Uh, these are my associates Melvin Frohike and Richard Langly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're the guys Scully told me about. Mulder's friends?

speaker: BYERS
line: Yes, that's us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You publish the "Lone Gunman" newspaper?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Our reputation precedes us.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. Read Mulder's files.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, then you know how badly you're going to need our help.

speaker: BYERS
line: We've reviewed your case as Agent Scully asked.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Mondo bizarro. No offense, man, but you're in way over your head.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What help can you give me?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hit the lights.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Are you familiar with this image?

speaker: BYERS
line: In the renaissance it represented an all-seeing god.

speaker: LANGLY
line: That's why our Founding Fathers put it on the dollar bill.

speaker: BYERS
line: We believe its meaning here relates to eastern religion, uh, belief in the third eye or what the Hindus call the Sahasrara.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A third eye?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We all have a third eye. If we could open it, we'd see a new reality, one closer to God. At least that's what Kesey told me on the bus back in '64.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You were not on the bus with Kesey in '64.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, I got the pictures to prove it, my longhaired friend.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Before or after you partied with the Stones at Altamont?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Don't be a boob, Altamont was in '70s.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Whatever.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I see where you guys are going with this. Tipet believes he opened his third eye.

speaker: BYERS
line: Yes, exactly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: But the placement of the wounds on his victims could suggest he's trying to destroy theirs.

speaker: BYERS
line: Yeah. That could be.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: But if he's moved closer to God, why kill him? And how?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We don't know why. But we might tell you how.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: You've heard of MK Ultra?

speaker: BYERS
line: The CIA mind control project started in the '50s.

speaker: LANGLY
line: They gave LSD to a bunch of people to see what would happen. Didn't bother telling them first.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: They understood the power of hallucinogens to harness the mind.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tipet was the one on hallucinogens, not his victims.

speaker: BYERS
line: The CIA invested millions trying to create psychic assassins, failing where Tipet has evidently succeeded.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Reaching a drug-induced higher consciousness using his mind as a weapon against his victims.

speaker: LANGLY
line: The assassin makes his victims think they're being hit by an axe.

speaker: BYERS
line: Or any number of nightmares.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: They believe it... it happens.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What if Tipet could invade his victims'... consciousness in their sleep? I mean, that's why you'd be afraid to fall asleep, right? If you thought your nightmares might come true?

speaker: BYERS
line: You believe that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No... but if Tipet does... he'll need more drugs... to keep killing.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's not bad for a beginner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Doggett, someone's been here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Anthony Tipet. Anthony Tipet! Step away from the saw.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: You don't understand.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Just step away from the saw.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: I didn't want this to happen... but I can't stop it.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: He understands. He saw what can happen-- what will happen... unless I stop it.

speaker: ER DOCTOR
line: I want a stat trauma panel with full tox, EKG, and metabolic profile. Keep that compress on his head.

speaker: NURSE
line: Agent... this man needs to be admitted. You need to sign him in.

speaker: NURSE
line: This is Nurse McCaslin. Yes, Dr. Johnson's on the third floor. All right.

speaker: KERSH
line: Come in, Agent Doggett. A.D. Skinner was telling me you could shed light on the reason for Tipet's suicide attempt.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yes, sir, um... "Via Negativa"-- the path of darkness. Tipet believed he reached it. Uh, he believed that the drugs took him inside the subconscious minds of anyone he knew...... making the most horrific, irrational dream imagery of their nightmares come true. That's why he tried to kill himself to make it stop.

speaker: KERSH
line: Excellent job, gentlemen. Have your reports on my desk 0900.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Case isn't over yet, sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: A.D. Skinner tells me our suspect's lying hospitalized in a coma and now, you're saying it's not over?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We have no murder weapon... no forensic evidence. Unless we accept Tipet's own beliefs which you yourself characterize as preposterous...

speaker: KERSH
line: It's over, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We have no way of explaining how he killed any of these people.

speaker: KERSH
line: I said it's over, Agent Doggett. I don't need every "I" dotted or every "T" crossed to know that we've got our man.

speaker: SCULLY'S ANSWERING MACHINE
line: This is Dana Scully. Please leave a message.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, I think we caught the guy who did it. But it... it still it... it just doesn't add up. It's the damnedest thing I ever saw. I know that this sounds strange, but there's a, there's a... part of me says what if... what if this guy was right? What if I shouldn't have let him die? I'm not making a whole lot of sense. Maybe I just need some sleep. If you get this message... and feel up to it... you give me a call.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is the Assistant Director in?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That'll be great. Thanks.

speaker: AGENT CRANE
line: John. Excellent work out there, John. Just excellent.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is something wrong?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not sure... I'm awake.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You think this is a dream? I mean, you standing here talking to me? All those people out there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Last night I dreamt Tipet was inside my house holding an axe. I thought I woke up this morning. I thought I was awake, but-but then...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh... What do you want me to do, pinch you? You're already awake.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Stedman and Leeds must have experienced the same thing... all Tipet's victims. Everything seemed real but it was a dream... a dream that ended in their deaths.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Anthony Tipet is in a coma, never to regain consciousness.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He knows me now. He can enter in my dreams.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Listen to me. You've had a tough couple days. You're tired. Go home, get some rest.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: She's going to die.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm not going to let you do that.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: I'm sorry. I'm not going to kill her.

speaker: ANTHONY TIPET
line: You are.

speaker: SCULLY'S VOICE
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett. Hi.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How'd you get here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your door was unlocked.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You just saved my life, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just woke you up, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tipet's in my dreams. If you hadn't woken me up just now...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Anthony Tipet is dead. I got the call from Skinner on my way over here. He never regained consciousness.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I seem to be, yes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, if you need some more time off...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I'm, um... I'm back at work now. That must have been some nightmare you just had.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tipet thought he'd find God by looking in the darkness inside himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't think he succeeded?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: In my dreams, I see... I saw terrible... violent images that... scared the living daylights out of me. These things are a part of me. I can't deny that, but... maybe... maybe they didn't come from me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then where'd they come from?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was a bad dream, Agent Doggett, but that's all it was.
